intro: Anchusa biceps, commonly known as the two-stemmed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Anchusa biceps is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
